title: (x) Decorative type on old sheet music cover - hand drawn (several alternatives) {gang}
content:
I realize that this is a handmade sheet music cover, and there are some embellishments to the face that are obviously one-of-a-kind, but can someone help point me to the closest font to match this:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/collegiate_5486.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Lulu slab serif logo - Berthold City {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29503 "Go to previous forum topic") [GE Inspira alternative? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29482 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Woodhouse

comments.content:
Whoa! There is no one font that matches this, surely? It has two differing constructions for ’a’ for a start, and two differing widths for the last two words.

You could start with something like [Clearface](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.linotype.com/616/itcclearface-family.html) and mess about with it yourself. Another one that reflects the style of the period is [Windsor.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.linotype.com/90458/windsor-family.html)

And you could probably find something at [http://www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "http://www.letterheadfonts.com") that comes closer to this than either of them, but I don’t know what it would be called.
I was going to say Letterhead Fonts as well but I looked through the site and came up with nothing.

You could try [Kilkenney](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=kilkennyset&face=kilkennyset). [Quaint Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/) share a few traits with your sample. As does [Edison Swirl](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/edison-swirl-sg/) and [Gable Antique](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/gable-antique-condensed-sg/).

You could check out the [Dover Victorian fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104828/http:/store.doverpublications.com/0486999564.html) cdrom – nothing quite matches this, but you might find something that creates a similar effect.
